questiontext.text: In a two-sided test on the difference between two averages and an alternative hypothesis that states that the difference is unequal to 0, a P-value of 0.10 means that

answer.text: The probability that the null hypothesis is TRUE given the difference in averages found is 0.10.

feedback.text: The probability that the null hypothesis is TRUE given the difference in averages found is 0.10: Incorrect

answer.text: The probability that the result found or more extreme given the null hypothesis is 0.10.

feedback.text: The probability of the result found or more extreme given the null hypothesis is 0.10: Correct

answer.text: The probability that the alternative hypothesis is TRUE given the difference in averages found is 0.10.

feedback.text: The probability that the alternative hypothesis is TRUE given the difference in averages found is 0.10: Incorrect Incorrect
